headline.main: U.N. Yemen Envoy to Step Down, May Be Replaced by Mauritanian: Source
headline.print_headline: U.N. Yemen Envoy to Step Down, May Be Replaced by Mauritanian: Source

docs.snippet: U.N. special adviser to Yemen Jamal Benomar is planning on stepping down from his job and U.N. chief Ban Ki-moon is considering appointing a Mauritanian diplomat to the post as the civil war escalates, a U.N. diplomatic source said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.N. special adviser to Yemen Jamal Benomar is planning on stepping down from his job and U.N. chief Ban Ki-moon is considering appointing a Mauritanian diplomat to the post as the civil war escalates, a U.N. diplomatic source said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Clinton Pledges Help for Small Businesses at Last Stop on Iowa Tour
headline.print_headline: Clinton Pledges Help for Small Businesses at Last Stop on Iowa Tour

docs.snippet: Democratic presidential contender Hillary Clinton promised on Wednesday to help small businesses, saying U.S. tax rules were skewed in favor of big corporations and made it time consuming and costly for small employers to navigate the tax code....
docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic presidential contender Hillary Clinton promised on Wednesday to help small businesses, saying U.S. tax rules were skewed in favor of big corporations and made it time consuming and costly for small employers to navigate the tax code.

headline.main: Ex-Vikings Tight End Voigt Indicted in Alleged Ponzi Scheme
headline.print_headline: Ex-Vikings Tight End Voigt Indicted in Alleged Ponzi Scheme

docs.snippet: Former Minnesota Vikings tight end Stu Voigt is charged in a federal indictment with conspiracy and fraud in an alleged Ponzi scheme, the U.S. Attorney's office said Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Minnesota Vikings tight end Stu Voigt is charged in a federal indictment with conspiracy and fraud in an alleged Ponzi scheme, the U.S. Attorney's office said Wednesday.

headline.main: Trial Opening in 1995 Killing Tied to Psychology Professor
headline.print_headline: Trial Opening in 1995 Killing Tied to Psychology Professor

docs.snippet: A prosecutor on Wednesday urged jurors to convict an Orange County man of kidnapping and killing another man 20 years ago and leaving his bloodied body on the side of a road after his then-girlfriend said he had raped her....
docs.lead_paragraph: A prosecutor on Wednesday urged jurors to convict an Orange County man of kidnapping and killing another man 20 years ago and leaving his bloodied body on the side of a road after his then-girlfriend said he had raped her.

headline.main: One Year on, Thailand's Testy Coup Leader Battles Dictator Label
headline.print_headline: One Year on, Thailand's Testy Coup Leader Battles Dictator Label

docs.snippet: The last two times Thailand's army grabbed control, in 2006 and 2014, fortune teller Warin Buawiratlert called it, informing the would-be junta ahead of time that they were destined for power....
docs.lead_paragraph: The last two times Thailand's army grabbed control, in 2006 and 2014, fortune teller Warin Buawiratlert called it, informing the would-be junta ahead of time that they were destined for power.

headline.main: NY Settles Suit Against Ernst & Young Over Lehman Audit
headline.print_headline: NY Settles Suit Against Ernst & Young Over Lehman Audit

docs.snippet: New York's attorney general has settled a lawsuit against Ernst & Young over auditing at the now-defunct investment bank Lehman Brothers for $10 million....
docs.lead_paragraph: New York's attorney general has settled a lawsuit against Ernst & Young over auditing at the now-defunct investment bank Lehman Brothers for $10 million.

headline.main: Court Rules GM Shielded From Death Claims Before Bankruptcy
headline.print_headline: Court Rules GM Shielded From Death Claims Before Bankruptcy

docs.snippet: A federal judge ruled Wednesday that a 2009 bankruptcy order shields General Motors from billions of dollars in death and injury claims tied to defective ignition switches in older small cars....
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge ruled Wednesday that a 2009 bankruptcy order shields General Motors from billions of dollars in death and injury claims tied to defective ignition switches in older small cars.

headline.main: U.S. Judge in California Keeps Marijuana Listed Among Most Dangerous Drugs
headline.print_headline: U.S. Judge in California Keeps Marijuana Listed Among Most Dangerous Drugs

docs.snippet: A federal judge in California declined on Wednesday to remove marijuana from the federal list of most dangerous narcotics, rejecting a closely watched request from people accused of illegally growing pot, prosecutors said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in California declined on Wednesday to remove marijuana from the federal list of most dangerous narcotics, rejecting a closely watched request from people accused of illegally growing pot, prosecutors said.

headline.main: Virtu IPO Priced at $19 Per Share-Market Source
headline.print_headline: Virtu IPO Priced at $19 Per Share-Market Source

docs.snippet: Virtu Financial Inc's initial public offering has been priced at $19 per Class A share, a market source told Reuters, valuing the electronic trading firm at about $2.60 billion (1.75 billion pounds)....
docs.lead_paragraph: Virtu Financial Inc's initial public offering has been priced at $19 per Class A share, a market source told Reuters, valuing the electronic trading firm at about $2.60 billion (1.75 billion pounds).
